intro: Chamaesyce australis, commonly known as the Australian sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant typically forms dense mats on sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters. Chamaesyce australis is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
